Inventory Manager Job at JNC International Limited




        
    

        
        JNC International Limited is a leading Turnkey Medical Equipment Service and Solutions Company in Nigeria. Our competences are noticeable throughout the healthcare space in Nigeria as we constantly look to improve and provide quality and affordable solutions for desired need through our innovative strategies for solutions delivery.

We are recruiting suitable candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Inventory Manager

Job Location: Lagos
Employment type: Full time

Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Oversee and manage all inventory control processes and maintain up-to-date records in Sage and other systems.
	Monitor, track, and forecast stock levels to prevent shortages or excess, and conduct routine audits and reconciliations.
	Ensure goods are received in good condition, properly stored, tagged, and allocated according to standards.
	Coordinate warehouse operations including product movement, loading/offloading, and daily reconciliations.
	Lead periodic stock counts and cycle checks, and provide accurate reports with recommendations.
	Work with procurement, logistics, distribution, and operations teams to meet business needs and ensure timely deliveries.
	Enforce safety, quality, and regulatory standards, and train staff on compliance.
	Provide leadership and guidance to the warehouse/inventory team and advise management on stock levels and process improvements.


Qualifications


	A Degree in Accounting, Supply Chain, Business Administration, or a related field.
	Minimum of 5 years of experience in warehouse or inventory management, including at least 1 year in a supervisory role.
	Strong knowledge of general business software, with the ability to quickly learn new applications.
	Excellent data analysis and forecasting skills.
	Ability to meet the physical demands of warehouse work, including standing, sitting, walking, and occasional lifting.
	Skilled in calculations such as discounts, freight estimates, dimensional weight, invoices, and percentages.
	Relevant certification in Supply Chain Management is an added advantage.
	Experience in the medical device industry is a plus.

Creative / Graphics Designer Job at Agurate Online Limited




        
    

        
        Agu.ng is a nationally recognized fashion retailer owned and managed by Agurate Online Limited. Agurate Online Limited was incorporated under the Nigerian laws by the Corporate affairs commission in August 2015. We’re passionate about Fashion retail both online and offline – and it goes way beyond fashion.
     

            
    



At Agu.ng, fashion is a way of life. We provide the best fashion materials and accesories. We are located in Onitsha Mall, Enugu mall, Novare mall lekki, Novare Gateway Mall Abuja and Circle mall Osapa. As we strive to bring your lovely fashion to your neighborhood, you can always shop on our website. We differentiate ourselves through a combination of unique designs and styles merged with unequaled standards of quality and authenticity. Our founders Agurate Online limited is a company built on hardwork, fairness and customer satisfaction.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Creative / Graphics Designer

Job Location: Lekki Phase I, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Description


	The Creative/Graphics Designer will be responsible for conceptualizing and executing compelling visual designs that reflect the brand’s identity, attract target customers, and enhance brand positioning across retail stores, e-commerce platforms, and digital marketing channels.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and maintain consistent brand aesthetics across all creative assets (print, digital, and in-store).
	Ensure visual guidelines are adhered to across campaigns, packaging, and promotional materials.
	Design engaging creatives for social media platforms (Instagram, TikTok, Facebook, X, Pinterest).
	Develop website and e-commerce banners, lookbooks, and product showcase visuals.
	Support digital marketing campaigns (email designs, paid ad creatives, influencer collaborations).
	Create store signage, window display concepts, posters, brochures, flyers, and catalogues.
	Design promotional and seasonal campaign visuals for in-store experiences.
	Edit and retouch product/lifestyle photos for catalogues and digital platforms.
	Support video and motion graphic needs for campaigns and reels.
	Work closely with marketing, operations, and e-commerce teams to translate business needs into creative concepts.
	Contribute to brainstorming sessions and idea development for seasonal campaigns and launches.


Key Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Graphic Design, Fine Arts, Visual Communication, or related field.
	Atleast 4 years of proven experience as a Graphic/Creative Designer
	Experience in the fashion, retail, or lifestyle industries will be an added advantage
	Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, After Effects) is key.
	Photography/photo-editing and basic video editing skills (Premiere Pro/Final Cut Pro) and motion graphics.
	Skilled in Figma/Canva for quick design execution.
	Familiarity with e-commerce platforms and social media content design best practices.
	Strong creative flair with attention to detail and aesthetics.
	Ability to translate abstract ideas into visually appealing outputs.
	Good time management and ability to handle multiple design projects simultaneously.
	Strong collaboration and communication skills.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their resume to: careers@agu.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Head of Engineering Job at Agbeyewa Farms




        
    

        
        Agbeyewa Farms is a world-class agribusiness with farm operations in Ekiti State, Nigeria. We have foresight for expansion into Africa whilst we create decent jobs and economic opportunities for local communities and become a force to reckon with in the agribusiness on a global scale.

We are recruiting to fill the position below

Job Position: Head of Engineering

Job Location: Ekiti
Job Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

            
    




	Lead the engineering department, including planning, development, and execution of engineering projects.
	Develop and implement engineering strategies that align with the company's agribusiness goals and objectives.
	Collaborate with cross-functional teams including research and development, operations, and product management to drive innovation and efficiency.
	Oversee all engineering projects from concept to completion, ensuring they are delivered on time, within scope, and budget.
	Implement best practices for project management, including risk management, resource allocation, and quality control.
	Provide technical guidance and mentorship to engineering teams.
	Ensure the integration of modern technologies, tools, and methodologies in engineering processes.
	Oversee the maintenance and optimization of existing systems and infrastructure.
	Drive innovation by researching and implementing new technologies and methodologies in agricultural engineering.
	Lead the development of sustainable and scalable engineering solutions that improve agricultural productivity and sustainability.
	Ensure all engineering activities comply with industry standards, safety regulations, and company policies.
	Promote a culture of safety, quality, and continuous improvement within the engineering teams.
	Engage with key stakeholders, including clients, suppliers, and regulatory bodies, to ensure alignment with business objectives.
	Communicate engineering progress, challenges, and solutions to senior management and other relevant parties.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in engineering (Agricultural, Mechanical, or related field); master’s degree preferred.
	10+ years of experience in engineering, with at least 5 years in a leadership role, preferably in the agribusiness or related sector.
	Proven track record of leading and managing engineering teams in a fast-paced environment.
	Strong understanding of agricultural engineering principles and practices.
	Proficiency in modern engineering tools, technologies, and project management software.
	Knowledge of sustainable farming practices and environmental regulations.
	Excellent leadership, team building, and communication skills.
	Strong problem-solving abilities and a strategic mindset.
	Experience with precision agriculture technologies, IoT, automation, and AI in agriculture.
	Familiarity with global agribusiness trends and challenges.
	Experience working in a multinational or diverse cultural environment.
	Ability to innovate and drive change.
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.


Remuneration


	Competitive Compensation.   
	5 - day workweek.    
	Competitive Health Insurance (Employee + Spouse + 4 children).   
	Wellness Programs   
	Employee Training Programs   
	Growth and Development   
	Mentoring and Counselling.
